W&L CS 1.title: Writing and Literature Colloquium
W&L CS 1.description: UCSB faculty working in Creative Writing, Writing Studies, and Literary Studies present their research or creative work to expose students to examples of topics, theories, and methods in those disciplines.

W&L CS 2.title: First Year Colloquium Seminar
W&L CS 2.description: Students engage in discussions of the presentations given in the Writing and Literature Colloquium. Focuses on introducing the disciplines and exploring the relationships between the material and the students' interests.

W&L CS 3.title: Second Year Colloquium Seminar
W&L CS 3.description: Students engage in discussions of the presentations given in the Writing and Literature Colloquium. Encourages deeper engagement with the material of the colloquium through reading of complementary texts and exploring application of methods and theories to the work students will commit to in the Mid-Residency Review.

W&L CS 4.title: Mid-Residency Review
W&L CS 4.description: Students present independent projects as a part of their required Mid-Residency Review.

W&L CS 5.title: Group Studies
W&L CS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Writing and Literature.

W&L CS 10.title: Introdution to Creative Writing
W&L CS 10.description: Provides an introduction to the major genres of creative writing, including fiction, poetry, and creative nonfiction. Focuses on the vocabulary and techniques of creative writing as well as the writing process.

W&L CS 11.title: Introductory Poetry Workshop
W&L CS 11.description: Introduction to the craft of poetry writing. Students develop original works of poetry to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 12.title: Introductory Fiction Workshop
W&L CS 12.description: Introduction to the craft of fiction writing. Students develop original works of short fiction to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 13.title: Introductory Creative Nonfiction Workshop
W&L CS 13.description: Introduction to the craft of creative nonfiction writing. Students develop original works of short creative nonfiction to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 14.title: Introductory Screenwriting Workshop
W&L CS 14.description: Introduction to the craft of screenwriting. Students develop original works for the screen to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 20.title: Introduction to Writing Studies
W&L CS 20.description: Provides an introduction to the intellectual orientation, practices, and epistemologies of Writing Studies.

W&L CS 30.title: Introduction to Literary Studies
W&L CS 30.description: Provides an introduction to the intellectual orientation, practices, and epistemologies of Literary Studies.

W&L CS 110.title: Poetry Workshop
W&L CS 110.description: Students write original poems to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of poetry as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 111.title: Outdoor Poetry
W&L CS 111.description: Students write original poems to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of poetry as well as strategies to generate and revise work. This workshop class focuses on writing poetry outside (with some time spent in the classroom). Students also read widely, and complete a portfolio of poems by quarter's end.

W&L CS 120.title: Fiction Workshop
W&L CS 120.description: Students write original works of fiction to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of fiction writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 121.title: Diaries to Stories
W&L CS 121.description: Students write diary entries as a literary form to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn to use diaries as a tool for invention and how to craft diary entries into narratives.

W&L CS 122.title: Novel Writing Workshop
W&L CS 122.description: Students should bring work from a novel-in-progress to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of travel writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 123.title: Vignettes and Very Short Fiction
W&L CS 123.description: Students write creative pieces--stories that are more or less based on their experiences using fictional techniques such as dialog and scenes. The course is the workshop so attendance is very important. Students write a piece for the various topics that are presented weekly and discuss stories anonymously in class. Students also write short critiques and do in class writing assignments.

W&L CS 130.title: Creative Nonfiction Workshop
W&L CS 130.description: Students write original works of creative nonfiction to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of creative nonfiction as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 131.title: Travel Writing Workshop
W&L CS 131.description: Students write original works of travel writing to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of travel writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 133.title: Food Writing Workshop
W&L CS 133.description: Students write original works of food writing to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of food writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 135.title: Memoir Writing Workshop
W&L CS 135.description: Students write original works of memoir to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of memoir writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 140.title: Playwriting Workshop
W&L CS 140.description: Students write original scripts to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of playwriting as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 141.title: Screenwriting Workshop
W&L CS 141.description: Students write original scripts to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of screenwriting as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 141A.title: Beginning Screenwriting Workshop
W&L CS 141A.description: Students learn the basic techniques of screenwriting. Students write original screenplays to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 141B.title: Advanced Screenwriting Workshop
W&L CS 141B.description: Students learn advanced techniques of screenwriting. Students write original screenplays to be read and discussed in a workshop setting.

W&L CS 142.title: Graphic Novel Workshop
W&L CS 142.description: Students write and illustrate original comic scripts to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of the craft of graphic novel writing as well as strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 143.title: Multimedia Writing Workshop
W&L CS 143.description: Students write original multimedia compositions to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn the essentials of multimedia composing as well as strategies to generate and revise. work.

W&L CS 149.title: Multigenre Writing Workshop
W&L CS 149.description: Students write original work in multiple genres to be read and discussed in a workshop setting. Students learn strategies to generate and revise work.

W&L CS 150AAZZ.title: Topics in Literary Studies
W&L CS 150AAZZ.description: Intensive study of varying topics in literary studies, including single authors, genres, themes.

W&L CS 151AAZZ.title: Reading Like a Writer - Single Author Study
W&L CS 151AAZZ.description: Invites students to complete intensive reading the works of a single author from the perspective of a writer. Students focus on how the elements of the craft demonstrated by the author might apply to their own work.

W&L CS 152AAZZ.title: Reading Like a Writer - Genre Study
W&L CS 152AAZZ.description: Invites students to complete intensive reading of a single genre from the perspective of a writer. Students focus on how the elements of the genre might apply to their own work.

W&L CS 153AAZZ.title: Reading Like a Writer - Thematic Study
W&L CS 153AAZZ.description: Invites students to complete intensive reading on a single theme from the perspective of a writer. Students focus on how the elements of the theme might apply to their own work.

W&L CS 160AAZZ.title: Topics in Writing Studies
W&L CS 160AAZZ.description: Intensive study of varying topics in the field of writing studies.

W&L CS 161AAZZ.title: Topics in Multimedia Writing
W&L CS 161AAZZ.description: Intensive study of varying topics in the area of multimedia writing in the field of writing studies.

W&L CS 170.title: Literary Publishing
W&L CS 170.description: Full-year course offering instruction in literary publication. Students apply what they learn to creating the CCS literary magazines Spectrum and Into the Teeth of the Wind or to an independent project. Topics covered include establishing an editorial perspective, developing and soliciting content, promotion, document design and layout, and strategies for copyediting.

W&L CS 170A.title: Introduction of Literary Publishing
W&L CS 170A.description: Students are introduced to the art and business of literary publishing in preparation for work on Spectrum Literary Journal and careers in writing or publishing.

W&L CS 170B.title: Literary Publishing: Selection
W&L CS 170B.description: Students read and select works to be published from submissions to Spectrum Literary Journal. Topics covered include establishing an editorial perspective, developing and soliciting content.

W&L CS 170C.title: Literary Publishing: Copyediting and Design
W&L CS 170C.description: Students copyedit works to be published in Spectrum Literary Journal and design the annual issue. Topics covered include promotion, document design and layout, and strategies for copyediting.

W&L CS 171.title: The Writer's Life
W&L CS 171.description: Students are exposed to potential professional applications of the Writing and Literature major through appropriate guest lectures, readings, and experiential learning opportunities.

W&L CS 190.title: Junior Tutorial
W&L CS 190.description: Students work independently with their faculty advisor to develop information and expertise necessary for their senior portfolio. May include training in methods, apprenticeship experience, or independent reading and coursework.

W&L CS 192.title: Teaching Practicum
W&L CS 192.description: Advanced instruction in the pedagogy of writing while assisting in W&L 191 under faculty supervision.

W&L CS 197.title: Senior Portfolio
W&L CS 197.description: Students work independently with their faculty advisor to complete their senior portfolio.

W&L CS 198.title: Internship
W&L CS 198.description: Academic credit for professional experience with an approved organization or individual.

W&L CS 199.title: Independent Study
W&L CS 199.description: Serious independent study in writing and literature with consenting faculty member.
